page.title: 16SHOPPING SURVEY (continued).
page.content: Nine children carried out a survey at the Crescent shops. Maxine did Gourleys,Angela did the Post Office, Carl did Spendlove's the greengrocers. Jacqueline did the chemist and the hairdressers, Tarnia did the butchers and the chandlers. The Post Office's most frequent visitors were elderly men. The most frequent people into Gourleys were middle-aged women. The most frequent into the chemist were girls under 16. The people who went into Spendlove's were mostly middle- aged women. Young men were the most frequent visitors to the hairdressers. Elderly women visited the butchers most frequently & also the chandlers. The busiest shop was the Post Office because it was pension day. People have not got money to spend on their hair so the hairdressers was the least busy. Written by class 4S.
